meanings.definition: The middle part of the brain, responsible for sensory and motor functions.
meanings.sent1: Doctors study the midbrains to understand how our body moves and feels.
meanings.sent2: The midbrains play a crucial role in processing information from our senses.
meanings.sent3: The midbrains must be working overtime when we try to balance on one foot!
meanings.sent4: Her midbrains seemed to have a mind of their own, guiding her through the dance effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: In the anatomy class, the teacher pointed out the midbrains on the diagram, making it easier to remember.

meanings.definition: The midbrain region of the brainstem, connecting the forebrain and hindbrain.
meanings.sent1: The midbrains act as a bridge between the front and back parts of the brain.
meanings.sent2: Signals pass through the midbrains to travel between different brain areas.
meanings.sent3: It's like the midbrains are the traffic controllers of the brain, directing information flow.
meanings.sent4: The midbrains are like the central hub of a busy airport, managing all the incoming and outgoing flights.
meanings.sent5: The midbrains are like the communication center of the brain, ensuring smooth interaction between brain regions.
